theorem_statement: Let $p$ be a prime number and let $A=\{1,p,p^2,p^3,\cdots \}$. We have \begin{equation} N^p_A(n)=\sum_{k=0}^{n-1}p_A(k)\left(\vartheta_p(n-k)+1\right). \end{equation}

sections.title: Generating Functions for $N_A^p(n)$ and $N_A^q(n)$, and Six ways to Convolution and Recurrence Identities
